events.originalText: At least 23 students died and dozens more fell ill at a primary school in the Indian state of Bihar after consuming a Midday Meal that was contaminated with pesticide.
events.subtitle: Bihar
events.headline: 23 students die after consuming contaminated Midday Meal in Bihar, India

events.originalText: A tainted milk powder scandal broke in China which ultimately involved an estimated 300,000 victims, the vast majority infants, with 54,000 hospitalized with kidney problems and 6 deaths.
events.subtitle: 2008 Chinese milk scandal
events.headline: China milk powder scandal affects 300,000 victims, 6 deaths reported

events.originalText: An earthquake of magnitude .mw-parser-output .tooltip-dotted{border-bottom:1px dotted;cursor:help}Mw6.6 struck Niigata Prefecture, Japan, causing a leak of radioactive gases from the Kashiwazaki-Kariwa Nuclear Power Plant.
events.subtitle: 2007 Chūetsu offshore earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Niigata, Japan causes leak of radioactive gases from nuclear power plant

events.originalText: Millennium Park, a public park in Chicago, Illinois, and the world's largest rooftop garden, opened to the public.
events.subtitle: Millennium Park
events.headline: Millennium Park, world's largest rooftop garden, opens in Chicago, Illinois

events.originalText: Fragments of Comet Shoemaker–Levy 9 began colliding with the planet Jupiter (impact site pictured), with the first impact causing a fireball that reached a peak temperature of 24,000 kelvin.
events.subtitle: Comet Shoemaker–Levy 9
events.headline: Comet Shoemaker–Levy 9 fragments collide with Jupiter, fireball reaches 24,000 kelvin

events.originalText: A Sikorsky S-61 helicopter operated by British Airways crashed in thick fog in the Celtic Sea, killing 20 of the 26 people on board.
events.subtitle: Sikorsky S-61
events.headline: British Airways helicopter crash in Celtic Sea kills 20

events.originalText: South Vietnamese Colonel Phạm Ngọc Thảo—an undetected communist spy—was reported dead due to injuries sustained during his capture, but it is generally assumed he was killed on the orders of military officials.
events.subtitle: Army of the Republic of Vietnam
events.headline: South Vietnamese Colonel Phạm Ngọc Thảo reported dead, suspected communist spy

events.originalText: The Catcher in the Rye, an American coming-of-age novel by J. D. Salinger, was first published.
events.subtitle: The Catcher in the Rye
events.headline: J.D. Salinger's 'The Catcher in the Rye' published for the first time

events.originalText: Korean War: A Korean People's Army unit massacred 31 prisoners of war of the U.S. Army on a mountain near the village of Tuman.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: Korean War: 31 U.S. Army prisoners massacred by Korean People's Army

events.originalText: Ethiopian emperor Haile Selassie  promulgated the nation's first modern constitution.
events.subtitle: Haile Selassie
events.headline: Ethiopian emperor Haile Selassie promulgates nation's first modern constitution

events.originalText: President George Washington signed the Residence Act, selecting a new permanent site along the Potomac River for the capital of the United States, which later became Washington, D.C.
events.subtitle: George Washington
events.headline: President George Washington selects site for capital of United States

events.originalText: Mozart's opera Die Entführung aus dem Serail premiered in Vienna, after which Emperor Joseph II anecdotally remarked that it had "too many notes".
events.subtitle: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
events.headline: Mozart's opera 'Die Entführung aus dem Serail' premieres in Vienna

events.originalText: The ten-year-old Richard II was crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey.
events.subtitle: Richard II of England
events.headline: Ten-year-old Richard II crowned King of England at Westminster Abbey

events.originalText: Muhammad ibn Yusuf (pictured), who later established the Emirate of Granada, the last Muslim state in Spain, was elected the ruler of Arjona.
events.subtitle: Muhammad I of Granada
events.headline: Muhammad ibn Yusuf elected ruler of Arjona, later establishes Emirate of Granada
